page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO OUR D-BLOCK
page.content: The D-block is predominately sea and harbour but also includes the coast- line of Girdleness and Nigg Bay. The small portion of land included is primarily recreational comprising a golf course,a park and part lies within the boundaries of a 'Country Park'.The land is mainly farmland and heath.The coastline at Nigg Bay is of significant geological value and is used by the University for fieldwork. The area is also steeped in history and contains Bronze Age cairns,13th Century church remains and more recent Napoleonic fortifications. Tar area once supported a prosperous quarrying industry employing almost 700 people in the late 1700's.Salt was panned and iodine manufactured from seaweed during this time as well.It is the sea rather than the land which is now of industrial significance.
